name: ServiceFabricComposeDeploy
description: Deploy a docker-compose application to a Service Fabric cluster.
author: Microsoft Corporation
instanceNameFormat: Deploy Compose Application to Service Fabric

inputs.name: serviceConnectionName
inputs.label: Cluster Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure Service Fabric service endpoint to be used to connect to the cluster. Choose 'Manage' to register a new endpoint.

inputs.name: composeFilePath
inputs.label: Compose File Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the compose file that is to be deployed. [Variables](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=550988) and wildcards can be used in the path.

inputs.name: applicationName
inputs.label: Application Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the application being deployed.

inputs.name: registryCredentials
inputs.label: Registry Credentials Source
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose if/how credentials for the docker registry will be provided.

inputs.name: dockerRegistryEndpointName
inputs.label: Docker Registry Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Docker registry connection. If a certificate matching the Server Certificate Thumbprint in the Cluster Connection is installed on the build agent, it will be used to encrypt the password; otherwise the password will not be encrypted.

inputs.name: registryPassword
inputs.label: Registry Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password for the Docker registry. If the password is not encrypted, it is recommended that you use a custom release definition secret variable to store it.

inputs.name: passwordEncrypted
inputs.label: Password Encrypted
inputs.helpMarkDown: It is recommended to encrypt your password using [Invoke-ServiceFabricEncryptText](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/service-fabric/service-fabric-application-secret-management#encrypt-application-secrets). If you do not, and a certificate matching the Server Certificate Thumbprint in the Cluster Connection is installed on the build agent, it will be used to encrypt the password; otherwise the password will not be encrypted.

inputs.name: deployTimeoutSec
inputs.label: Deploy Timeout (s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Timeout in seconds for deploying the application.

inputs.name: removeTimeoutSec
inputs.label: Remove Timeout (s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Timeout in seconds for removing an existing application.

inputs.name: getStatusTimeoutSec
inputs.label: Get Status Timeout (s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Timeout in seconds for getting the status of an existing application.
